div.head: Boundary Dispute between Ortopla and Parentium

p.seg: This rupestral boundary marker, cut into a natural limestone cliff in the eastern range of the Velebit mountains in Croatia, attests to a boundary disputebetween the settlements of Ortopla (mod. Stinica in Croatia) and Parentium (mod. Poreč). The dispute was resolved through negotiation. No mention is made of involvement by any Roman official.This marker also indicates that there was a legal right-of-way granted to the Ortoplini for access to a water source located within the territory of Parentium. It may be that this water source was at least a partial cause of the dispute.

div.p: By agreement. Boundary between the Ortoplini and the Parentini. Access to the spring for the Ortoplini: 500 paces (long) and 1 wide.
